1/ INFâ€™s primary purpose is to be a deep liquidity source for our partnersâ€™ LSTs.

Letâ€™s dive into why growing its AUM is ğŸ”‘ 
2/ Every epoch, INF unlocks SOL that enables most of our partnersâ€™ LSTs to exist.

And as those LSTs continue to expand, their liquidity demands do as well.

If INFâ€™s AUM growth doesnâ€™t adequately match the growth of LSTsâ€¦
3/ Infinity becomes less efficient at servicing liquidity demands.

So, at Sanctum, our job is to expand INFâ€™s AUM to preserve the optimal liquidity level that keeps the Solana LST ecosystem growing.

At the center of this is INFâ€™s reserve ğŸ‘‡
4/ The reserve is essential for enabling instant swaps, but it also introduces what we call â€˜SOL dragâ€™.

Long story short, when INFâ€™s AUM decreases, its idle SOL (in the reserve) takes up a higher % of the total AUM. Because a higher % of INF isnâ€™t earning yield, INFâ€™s APY goes down.

When this occurs, INF of course becomes less attractive to depositors. And fewer deposits means less liquidity for our partnersâ€™ LSTs.
5/ To recap, INF growth (positive or negative) is somewhat of a flywheel.

The more it grows, the better the APY appeal, the more deposits attracted, and the more liquidity for our partners.

When growth stagnates, the opposite is true.

Thatâ€™s why INF growth matters for the LST ecosystem!
